    LasIO.GeoDoubleParamsTag
    LasIO.GeoKeys — Type.

    Create GeoKeys from EPSG code. Assumes CRS is projected and in meters.

    LasIO.LasPoint — Type.

    Abstract type for ASPRS LAS point data record formats 0 - 3

    LasIO.LasPoint0 — Type.

    ASPRS LAS point data record format 0

    source

    ASPRS LAS point data record format 1

    source

    source

    LasIO.LasPointColor
    LasIO.LasPointTime
    LasIO.LasVariableLengthRecord — Type.

    A LAS "variable length record" - the generic way to store extra user or organization defined binary metadata in LAS files.

    LasIO.PointVector — Type.

    Custom PointVector struct for memory mapped LasPoints. Inspiration taken from UnalignedVector.jl and extended it with custom indexing and packing.

    ColorTypes.RGB — Type.

    The RGB color associated with this point

    LasIO.SRID
    LasIO.__init__
    ColorTypes.blue — Function.

    The blue image channel value associated with this point

    LasIO.classification — Function.

    Classification value as defined in the ASPRS classification table.

    LasIO.edge_of_flight_line — Function.

    If true, it is the last point before the scanner changes direction.

    LasIO.epsg_code — Function.

    Get the EPSG code of the projection in the header

    LasIO.epsg_code! — Function.

    Set the projection in the header, without altering the points

    LasIO.eval
    LasIO.flag_byte — Function.

    Flag byte, contains return number, number of returns, scan direction flag and edge of flight line

    Flag byte, as represented in the point data, built up from components

    LasIO.generate_io
    LasIO.generate_read — Function.

    Generate read (unpack) method for structs.

    LasIO.generate_write — Function.

    Generate write (pack) method for structs.

    LasIO.gps_time — Function.

    Time tag value at which the point was aquired, a Float64; see is_standard_gps for what it represents

    Convert DateTime to GPS Float64, as represented in the point data, assumes time is recorded in Adjusted Standard GPS Time; see is_standard_gps

    ColorTypes.green — Function.

    The green image channel value associated with this point

    LasIO.id_geoasciiparamstag
    LasIO.id_geodoubleparamstag
    LasIO.id_geokeydirectorytag
    LasIO.include
    LasIO.intensity — Function.

    Integer representation of the pulse return magnitude.

    LasIO.is_srs — Function.

    test whether a vlr is a GeoKeyDirectoryTag, GeoDoubleParamsTag or GeoAsciiParamsTag

    LasIO.is_standard_gps — Function.

    If true, GPS Time is standard GPS Time (satellite GPS Time) minus 1e9. If false, GPS Time is GPS Week Time.

    Note that not all software sets this encoding correctly.

    LasIO.is_wkt — Function.

    Check if the projection information is in WKT format (true) or GeoTIFF (false)

    LasIO.key_point — Function.

    If true, this point is considered to be a model key-point.

    LasIO.load
    LasIO.number_of_returns — Function.

    The total number of returns for a given pulse.

    LasIO.pointformat
    LasIO.pt_src_id — Function.

    This value indicates the file from which this point originated.

    LasIO.raw_classification — Function.

    Raw classification byte, contains classification, synthetic, key point and withheld

    Raw classification byte, as represented in the point data, built up from components

    LasIO.read_header
    LasIO.read_vlr_data
    LasIO.readstring
    ColorTypes.red — Function.

    The red image channel value associated with this point

    LasIO.return_number — Function.

    The pulse return number for a given output pulse, starting at one.

    LasIO.save
    LasIO.savebuf
    LasIO.scan_angle — Function.

    Angle at which the laser point was output, including the roll of the aircraft.

    LasIO.scan_direction — Function.

    If true, the scanner mirror was traveling from left to right at the time of the output pulse.

    LasIO.skiplasf
    LasIO.synthetic — Function.

    If true, the point was not created from lidar collection

    LasIO.update! — Function.

    Update the header bounding box and count based on point data

    LasIO.user_data — Function.

    This field may be used at the user’s discretion.

    LasIO.withheld — Function.

    If true, this point should not be included in processing

    LasIO.write_key_entry
    LasIO.writestring
    LasIO.xcoord — Function.

    X coordinate (Float64), apply scale and offset according to the header

    X value (Int32), as represented in the point data, reversing the offset and scale from the header

    LasIO.ycoord — Function.

    Y coordinate (Float64), apply scale and offset according to the header

    Y value (Int32), as represented in the point data, reversing the offset and scale from the header

    LasIO.zcoord — Function.

    Z coordinate (Float64), apply scale and offset according to the header

    Z value (Int32), as represented in the point data, reversing the offset and scale from the header
